title: PM Capital's Paul Moore: snake wrangler
text:
PM Capital's Paul Moore, pictured far from the wilds of Terrey Hills. Louie Douvis

We’ve long known funds management has its share of snakes. But we had, perhaps, underestimated the reptilian familiarity of PM Capital principal Paul Moore. With the non-metaphorical kind, that is.

Over the weekend, the Manly Daily reported on a local who'd turned to a Terrey Hills community Facebook page for advice about how to deal with a death adder he'd found in his garden. As the name suggests, the thing is pretty lethal.

While he wasn't the one that posted on Facebook, the said snake was found, we can reveal, on Moore's very spread in Terrey Hills.

It's a bit of a local hazard up there. "We've had plenty of pythons", the fund manager said when we asked about it. The pythons tend to hide in his toilets. "But this was a bit scarier."

Unitholders in the $2 billion globally-focussed PM Capital founded and still run by Moore can rest assured: he swears he had nothing to do with ultimately moving the unwanted and rather venomous guest.
description: Paul Moore swears he had nothing to do with ultimately moving the venomous, unwanted guest, but it was found on his property.
